alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:21PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL, HARDING, SOUTHWESTERN UNION, EAST CENTRAL MORA AND SOUTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 421 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Chicosa Lake State Park, or 24 miles north of Mosquero, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roy, Mosquero, Bueyeros, Abbott, Chicosa Lake State Park, Solano, Farley, Gladstone, Mills and Yates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Union County
